titleStmt.title: J. A. Middleton to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1704

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hodgenville Larue County Ky Oct 14th/63
To his Excellency Tho E Bramlette
Dear Sir I hereby Resign my office as Justice of the peace for the first District in Larue County, and woud Suggest Samuel Allen as being a Suitable person to fill the office

Very Respectfully
Yours
J A Middleton
We the undersigned would also Recommend Saml Allen as a Suitable person to fill the office hereby vacated

J H Rodman
Saml Wilson
E. R. Burba clk L C C
J H. Thomas

Larue Co
J. P.
Saml Allen
appd.
16th Oct/63

Oct 15th 1863
Accepted & commission issued to the person recommended
Tho E Bramlette
Govr.
